ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
The Camera Hardware Engineering group is responsible for the design, development, and innovation of camera hardware for all related Apple products such as iPhone, iPad, MacBook and more. Our target is to delivery the superior camera hardware, and best-in-class camera user experience.
We are now looking for someone whoâ€™s enthusiastic and willing to take the challenges to work with us as an exceptional electrical engineer.

ul.li: Expertise in electronic design, including component selection, schematic design, and schematic capture with tools like Cadence Allegro and OrCAD Capture
Extensive experience with EE design for digital circuits, including high-speed video interfaces and low-speed serial control interfaces
Extensive experience with EE design and layout for low-noise linear and switching power supply circuits
Knowledge of layout strategies for EMI minimization, signal integrity and low noise
Comfort and ability to use all types of electronic test equipment
Broad knowledge of engineering concepts (device behavior, data analysis, and systems modeling)
Ability to manage many projects and project types
Demonstrated ability to diagnose and solve performance problems
Great interpersonal skills - the ability to collaborate across groups
Excellent process development and documentation skills

div.p:
Core Responsibilities:
Engineering duties include component analysis, silicon specification, schematic design, circuit review, layout review and general debugging.
Collaborate closely with camera module design teams.
Determine component requirements, and develop schematic designs for new camera modules containing digital image sensors, microcontrollers, low-noise power supplies, LED drivers, and high-speed serial interfaces.
Analyze circuit parasitics and tolerances to ensure correct operation over the specified voltage and temperature ranges.
Direct layout and/or supervision of layout for PCB, Flex, and Ceramic substrates
Debug EE issues, including power quality, high-speed signal integrity and I2C interface performance.
Electrical test and validation of all electrical designs
Author clear and comprehensive electrical test documentation for manufacturing partners to complete electrical test and validation
Simulation, test, and validation of EMI and ESD performance of all designs
Develop new test equipment and procedures for camera module validation and production test.
Develop electronic prototypes for new camera features and product concepts
BS/MS/PhD in a relevant field (EE, CS or Physics)

Experience with PCB layout
Familiarity with camera and optics technology
Familiarity with CMOS image sensors is helpful, but not required
Familiarity with micro-controller and instrument programming
Experience using Matlab and/or Labview
Occasional travel may be required, but is not a critical component of this position.
Proficient verbal and written english language skills. Additional languages a plus.
